pullRequest.body:
This allows to leave out the not-nil hypothesis, in addition to not needing it for
the definition of tail.

---

### PR summary [163e433d41](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15237/commits/163e433d41fdd9bb3eb38c830245cfe944c40ded)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ adj_getVert_one`
`+ drop`
`+ getVert_cons`
`+ getVert_cons_one`
`+ getVert_cons_succ`
`+ getVert_copy`
`+ not_nil_iff_lt_length`
`+ support_tail_of_not_nil`
`+ tail_cons_eq`
`+ tail_cons_nil`
`- adj_sndOfNotNil`
`- cons_getVert`
`- cons_getVert_succ`
`- cons_sndOfNotNil`
`- getVert_one`
`- sndOfNotNil`
`- tail_support_eq_support_tail`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

</details>

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Just force-pushed after rebasing because of the #14977 merge:)

Thanks!

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10235916912/job/28317333099)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10235916912/job/28317333271)

```suggestion
```
Fixed

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma getVert_copy  {u v w x: V} (p : G.Walk u v) (i : â„•) (h : u = w) (h' : v = x) :
```
Added:)

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma getVert_ cons_one (q : G.Walk v w) (hadj : G.Adj u v) :
```
This one is a consequence of cons_getVert_succ and getVert_zero. I couldn't figure out how to add it without the linter shouting at me, am I missing something?
Oh the linter is right here. Forget me :)

Well actually please do
```suggestion
lemma getVert_cons_one (q : G.Walk v w) (hadj : G.Adj u v) :
```
still
Fixed along with some other misnames:)

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma getVert_tail {u v n} (p : G.Walk u v) (hnp: Â¬ p.Nil) :
```
Added:)

```suggestion
  List.mem_of_mem_tail <| support_tail p hp.1.not_nil â–¸ hp.isHamiltonian_tail.mem_support _
```

```suggestion
  rwa [getVert_zero] at this
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

This kind of indenting is quite bad style as people might have to reindent if the `match` ends up taking more characters in the future. In that case it's better to
```suggestion
  | .cons h q =>
    simp only [tail_cons, getVert_cons_succ, support_copy, support_cons, List.tail_cons]
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma getVert_copy  {u v w x : V} (p : G.Walk u v) (i : â„•) (h : u = w) (h' : v = x) :
```

Can't omega just do it? 
```suggestion
      omega
```
Nope, doesn't look like omega gets this in one go

```suggestion
  cases p, i with
  | nil, _ =>
    rw [getVert_of_length_le _ (by simp only [length_nil, Nat.zero_le] : nil.length â‰¤ _)]
    rw [getVert_of_length_le _ (by simp only [length_copy, length_nil, Nat.zero_le])]
    exact h'.symm
  | cons hadj q, 0 => simp only [hi, getVert_zero, h.symm]
  | cons hadj q, i + 1 => simp only [copy_cons, getVert_cons_succ, getVert_copy]
```
or something like that

In fact, since the `cases` is the first thing in the proof, it would be better to even get rid of the tactic mode proof and do pattern matching instead

There's something funky going on here that I can't quite put my finger on.

A match outside tactic mode complains about a type mismatch for the nil.
A match inside tactic mode errors with `Case tag 'rhs' not found.`
It seems to have something to do with the copy in the statement, as soon as i remove that there's no problems. 
cases also doesn't seem to support multiple arguments? I tried something with a product, but that didn't seem to work either.

Any pointers?:)
@YaelDillies I accidently resolved this conversation, so just a friendly tag to make sure it's doesn't disappear in the void
Fixed this by using subst_vars

```suggestion
    p.IsHamiltonianCycle â†” p.IsCycle âˆ§ p.tail.IsHamiltonian :=
```
Fixed

Can you get something of the form
```suggestion
  simp (config := { contextual := true }) [isHamiltonianCycle_isCycle_and_isHamiltonian_tail,
    IsHamiltonian, support_tail, IsCycle.not_nil, exists_prop]
```
to work? You will my suggestion in the comment just above for this one to work
Worked as is:)

This proof really should be
```suggestion
  simpa using adj_getVert_succ p (by simpa)
```
Can you add simp lemmas until something of the above works?
`simpa using adj_getVert_succ p (by simpa : 0 < p.length)` works except for the second simpa, but simping "not nil" to "0 < p.length" seems pretty impactful, are you sure we want to be doing that?

I managed to get it to this:

```
@[simp] lemma adj_getVert_one {p : G.Walk v w} (hp : Â¬ p.Nil) :
    G.Adj v (p.getVert 1) := by
  have := adj_getVert_succ p (by simpa [not_nil_iff_lt_length] using hp)
  simp only [getVert_zero, zero_add] at this
  exact this
```

which works

but

```
@[simp] lemma adj_getVert_one {p : G.Walk v w} (hp : Â¬ p.Nil) :
    G.Adj v (p.getVert 1) := by
  simpa [getVert_zero, zero_add] using adj_getVert_succ p (by simpa [not_nil_iff_lt_length] using hp)
```
errors with

```
type mismatch
  hâœ
has type
  G.Adj (p.getVert 0) (p.getVert (0 + 1)) : Prop
but is expected to have type
  G.Adj v (p.getVert 1) : Prop
```

Any clue what's going on here?
Hmm... no clue, no. If you manage to minimise it, try posting it on #mathlib4 or #lean4 (depending on whether you got rid of the mathlib dependencies or not)
Type hinting the second simpa works. I don't think there's a bug with simpa, since using rwa in the second part leads to the same problem. Fixed in it that way
Probably some metavariable instantiating too late

```suggestion
/-- The walk obtained by removing the first `n` darts of a walk. -/
```
Fixed
Yeah now it kind of looks like we could just remove this definition entirely. I need to think more...

My thinking here is tailing a walk is a relatively common operation, dropping n not so much. I think from a generic software engineering perspective I think it makes sense to have tail because it clearly communicates what you're doing and it also intuitively matches what you expect from tail in a functional context.
I agree. I guess we should a bit longer to see whether more uses appear in Mathlib

Just to be clear, I was defending keeping tail, but are you proposing removing drop? (I'm actually tempted to keep drop too, since it's a piece of future engineering that has negligent maintenance burden, we could add drop lemma's when drop is actually used)
I was proposing removing tail. To be clear, no action needs to be taken in this PR, and I tend to agree with your usability argument.

```suggestion
lemma tail_cons_eq (h : G.Adj u v) (p : G.Walk v w) :
    (p.cons h).tail = p.copy (getVert_zero p).symm rfl := by
```
Fixed
Please don't include blank lines in proofs. If you feel like the proof could do with some more control flow, please add comments instead of blank lines
Fixed:)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): remove sndOfNotNil in favour of getVert 1
